title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement stephus.daus@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Create a Pre-defined Directory Hierarchy on Disk — create_directory_structure
code: create_directory_structure(   path = getwd(),   structure_path = system.file("templates", "_project_structure_en.yaml", package =     "saros.base"),   numbering_prefix = c("none", "max_local", "max_global"),   numbering_inheritance = TRUE,   word_separator = NULL,   numbering_parent_child_separator = word_separator,   numbering_name_separator = " ",   case = c("asis", "sentence", "title", "lower", "upper", "snake"),   replacement_list = c(project_initials = "SSN"),   create = FALSE,   count_existing_folders = FALSE )

title: Create a Pre-defined Directory Hierarchy on Disk — create_directory_structure
text: path String, path create project files structure_path String. Path YAML file defines folder structure. Defaults system.file("templates", "_project_structure_en.yaml"). numbering_prefix String. One c("none", "max_local", "max_global"). numbering_inheritance Flag. Whether inherit numbering parent folder. word_separator String. Replace separators words folder names. Defaults NULL. numbering_parent_child_separator String. Defaults word_separator. numbering_name_separator String. Separator numbering part name. case String. One c("asis", "sentence", "lower", "upper", "title", "snake"). replacement_list named character vector. name vector replaced "{{value}}" structure_path file create Boolean. Defaults TRUE initialize_saros_project(), FALSE create_directory_structure(). count_existing_folders Boolean. Defaults FALSE.

title: Create Data Frame Containing Email Drafts with User Credentials — create_email_credentials

Whether usernames existing password file email file result warnings. email_body, email_subject String, subject line email body respectively. Supports glue syntax referring columns found email data frame password file. ... Dynamic dots forwarded quarto::quarto_render

what: Create Folder with Placeholder R-files Based on Structure in CSV-file — create_r_files
title: Create Folder with Placeholder R-files Based on Structure in CSV-file — create_r_files
text: Create Folder Placeholder R-files Based Structure CSV-file

title: Create Folder with Placeholder R-files Based on Structure in CSV-file — create_r_files
code: create_r_files(   r_files_out_path,   r_files_source_path = system.file("templates", "r_files.csv", package = "saros.base"),   r_optionals = TRUE,   r_add_file_scope = TRUE,   r_prefix_file_scope = "### ",   r_add_folder_scope_as_README = FALSE,   word_separator = NULL,   case = c("asis", "sentence", "title", "lower", "upper", "snake"),   numbering_prefix = c("none", "max_local", "max_global"),   numbering_inheritance = TRUE,   numbering_parent_child_separator = word_separator,   numbering_name_separator = " " )

title: Create Folder with Placeholder R-files Based on Structure in CSV-file — create_r_files
text: r_files_out_path String, path place R placeholder files. NULL, create . r_files_source_path String, path find CSV-field containing columns folder_name, folder_scope, file_name, file_scope. NULL, defaults system.file("templates", "r_files.csv")). r_optionals Flag. Whether add files marked 1 (TRUE) optional column. Defaults TRUE. r_add_file_scope Flag. Whether add value column 'file_scope' beginning file. Default TRUE. r_prefix_file_scope String add file_scope. Defaults "### " r_add_folder_scope_as_README Flag. Whether create README file folder folder_scope column cell r_files_source_path. Defaults FALSE. word_separator String. Replace separators words folder names. Defaults NULL. case String. One c("asis", "sentence", "lower", "upper", "title", "snake"). numbering_prefix String. One c("none", "max_local", "max_global"). numbering_inheritance Flag. Whether inherit numbering parent folder. numbering_parent_child_separator String. Defaults word_separator. numbering_name_separator String. Separator numbering part name.

title: Create Folder with Placeholder R-files Based on Structure in CSV-file — create_r_files
code: create_r_files(r_files_out_path=tempdir())

what: Wrapper to Download and Unzip a Github Repository to A Folder — download_zip_to_folder
title: Wrapper to Download and Unzip a Github Repository to A Folder — download_zip_to_folder
text: Wrapper Download Unzip Github Repository Folder

title: Wrapper to Download and Unzip a Github Repository to A Folder — download_zip_to_folder
code: download_zip_to_folder(   github_zip_url = "https://github.com/NIFU-NO/nifutemplates/archive/refs/heads/main.zip",   zip_path = tempfile(fileext = ".zip"),   files = NULL,   out_path = getwd(),   prompt = TRUE,   overwrite = FALSE,   open_project = FALSE,   newSession = TRUE )

title: Wrapper to Download and Unzip a Github Repository to A Folder — download_zip_to_folder
text: github_zip_url URL zip file, string. zip_path String, store zip-file. Defaults temporary location. files Character vector files zip-file include. See zip::unzip(). out_path String, directory store unzipped files. prompt Flag, whether ask user conflicting files overwritten, . Defaults TRUE. overwrite Flag, whether overwrite files out_path. Defaults FALSE. open_project Flag string. FALSE (default), nothing. TRUE (requires rstudioapi-pkg), opens assumed .Rproj-file out_path copying, gives warning found. Alternatively, string (path) can provided. Defaults file.path(out_path, ".Rproj") exists. Set NULL FALSE ignore. newSession Flag. Whether open new project new RStudio session. Defaults TRUE.

title: Wrapper to Download and Unzip a Github Repository to A Folder — download_zip_to_folder
text: Character vector unzipped files.

title: Wrapper to Download and Unzip a Github Repository to A Folder — download_zip_to_folder

what: Automatically Draft a Quarto Report — draft_report
title: Automatically Draft a Quarto Report — draft_report
text: draft_report() function takes raw dataset (data-argument) output refine_chapter_overview()-function chapter_structure-argument outputs set pre-populated qmd-files specified path-folder. can edit, render, ultimately publish usual Quarto features RStudio. See also {saros.post}-package post-processing tools.

title: Automatically Draft a Quarto Report — draft_report
code: draft_report(   data,   chapter_structure,   ...,   path = tempdir(),   title = "Report",   authors = NULL,   authors_col = "author",   chapter_yaml_file = NULL,   chapter_qmd_start_section_filepath = NULL,   chapter_qmd_end_section_filepath = NULL,   index_filename = "index",   index_yaml_file = NULL,   index_qmd_start_section_filepath = NULL,   index_qmd_end_section_filepath = NULL,   report_filename = "0_report",   report_yaml_file = NULL,   report_qmd_start_section_filepath = NULL,   report_qmd_end_section_filepath = NULL,   ignore_heading_for_group = c(".template_name", ".variable_type_dep",     ".variable_type_indep", ".variable_group_dep", "chapter"),   replace_heading_for_group = c(.variable_label_suffix_dep = ".variable_name_dep",     .variable_label_suffix_indep = ".variable_name_indep"),   prefix_heading_for_group = NULL,   suffix_heading_for_group = NULL,   require_common_categories = TRUE,   combined_report = TRUE,   attach_chapter_dataset = TRUE,   auxiliary_variables = NULL,   serialized_format = c("rds", "qs"),   max_path_warning_threshold = 260,   log_file = NULL )

title: Automatically Draft a Quarto Report — draft_report
text: data Survey data obj:<data.frame>|obj:<tbl_df>|obj:<srvyr> // Required data frame (srvyr-object) columns specified chapter_structure 'dep', etc columns. chapter_structure goes chapter sub-chapter obj:<data.frame>|obj:<tbl_df> // Required Data frame (tibble, possibly grouped). One row per chapter. contain columns 'chapter' 'dep', Optionally 'indep' (independent variables) informative columns needed. ... Dynamic dots <dynamic-dots> Arguments forwarded corresponding functions create elements. path Output path scalar<character> // default: tempdir() (optional) Path save output. Defaults temporary directory. title Title report scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Added automatically YAML-header index.qmd report.qmd-files. authors Authors entire report vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) NULL, infers chapter_structure[[authors_col]], collates entire report. multiple authors per chapter, separate semicolon. Ensure consistency. authors_col Column name author scalar<character> // default: "author" (optional) used exists. Multiple authors separated semicolon (optionally subsequent space). chapter_yaml_file Path YAML-file insert chapter qmd-file scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Path file used insert header YAML, chapter. chapter_qmd_start_section_filepath, chapter_qmd_end_section_filepath, index_qmd_start_section_filepath, index_qmd_end_section_filepath, report_qmd_start_section_filepath, report_qmd_end_section_filepath, Path qmd-bit start/end qmd scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Path qmd-snippet placed /body chapter/index/report qmd-files. index_filename Index filename scalar<character> // default: "index.qmd" (optional) name main index Quarto file used landing page report. link PDF (report.qmd) collects chapters. index_yaml_file, report_yaml_file Path YAML-file insert index.qmd 0_report.qmd respectively scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Path file used insert header YAML, index report files. report_filename Report filename scalar<character> // default: "0_report.qmd" (optional) name main report QMD-file used compiling complete report collecting chapters folder (except ). provided, linked index. NULL, generate filename based report title, prefixed "0_". turn , set pdf=FALSE. ignore_heading_for_group Ignore heading group vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Type refined chapter_structure data suppress heading report output. Typically variable_name_dep, variable_name_indep, etc. replace_heading_for_group Replacing heading group named vector<character> // default: c(".variable_label_suffix_dep" = ".variable_name_dep") Occasionally, one needs replace heading another piece information refined chapter_structure. instance, one may want organize output variable_name_indep, display variable_label_indep instead. Use name replacement value original. prefix_heading_for_group, suffix_heading_for_group Prefix suffix headings vector<named character> // default: NULL (optional) Names heading_groups, values prefixes suffixes. Note prefixes end \n headings must begin new line. require_common_categories Check common categories scalar<logical> // default: NULL (optional) Whether check items share common categories. combined_report Create combined report? scalar<logical> // default: FALSE (optional) Whether create qmd file merges chapters combined report. attach_chapter_dataset Toggle inclusion chapter-specific datasets qmd-files scalar<logical> // default: FALSE Whether save chapter folder 'Rds'-file chapter-specific dataset, load top QMD-file. auxiliary_variables Auxiliary variables included datasets vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Column names data always included datasets chapter qmd-files, attach_chapter_dataset=TRUE. publicly available. serialized_format Serialized format scalar<string> // default: "rds" Format serialized data storing chapter dataset. One "rds" (default), "qs" "fst". latter two requires respective packages installed. "qs" usually fastest space efficient, sets package dependencies report project. max_path_warning_threshold Maximum number characters paths warning scalar<integer> // default: 260 (optional) Microsoft set absolute limit 260 characters Sharepoint/OneDrive file paths. mean files cache (hash suffixes added) quickly breach limit. set, warning returned files found longer threshold. Also note spaces count three characters due URL-conversion: %20. avoid test, set Inf log_file Path log file scalar<string> // default: "_log.txt" (optional) Path log file. Set NULL disable logging.

title: Automatically Draft a Quarto Report — draft_report
text: path-argument.

title: Automatically Draft a Quarto Report — draft_report
text: Note saros treats data stored: numeric, integer, factor, ordinal, character, datetime. Currently, factor/ordinal character implemented.

title: Automatically Draft a Quarto Report — draft_report
code: # \donttest{ ex_survey_ch_structure <-   refine_chapter_overview(           chapter_overview = ex_survey_ch_overview,           data = ex_survey) #> `chunk_templates` is NULL. Using global defaults. #> Refining chapter_overview into a chapter_structure ... #> Not using the following variables in `data`: `x2_human`, `a_7`, `a_8`, `c_1`, #> `c_2`, `f_uni`, and `resp_status`. index_filepath <-  draft_report(     chapter_structure = ex_survey_ch_structure,     data = ex_survey,     path = tempdir()) #> 1.465 0.005 1.469 0 0 # }

what: ex_survey: Mockup dataset of a survey. — ex_survey
title: ex_survey: Mockup dataset of a survey. — ex_survey
text: dataset containing fake respondents' answers survey questions. first two, x_sex x_human, intended independent variables, whereas remaining dependent. underscore _ variable names separates item groups (prefix) items (suffix) (.e. a_1-a_9 => + 1-9), whereas ' - ' separates labels. latter corresponds default SurveyXact.

title: ex_survey: Mockup dataset of a survey. — ex_survey
code: ex_survey

title: ex_survey: Mockup dataset of a survey. — ex_survey
text: data frame 100 rows 29 variables: x1_sex Gender x2_human respondent human? x3_nationality respondent born? a_1 consent following? - Agreement #1 a_2 consent following? - Agreement #2 a_3 consent following? - Agreement #3 a_4 consent following? - Agreement #4 a_5 consent following? - Agreement #5 a_6 consent following? - Agreement #6 a_7 consent following? - Agreement #7 a_8 consent following? - Agreement #8 a_9 consent following? - Agreement #9 b_1 much like living - Beijing b_2 much like living - Brussels b_3 much like living - Budapest c_1 many years experience - Company c_2 many years experience - Company B d_1 Rate degree confidence following - Driving d_2 Rate degree confidence following - Drinking d_3 Rate degree confidence following - Driving d_4 Rate degree confidence following - Dancing e_1 often following? - Eat e_2 often following? - Eavesdrop e_3 often following? - Exercise e_4 often following? - Encourage someone recently met struggles simple tasks achieve p_1 extent agree disagree following policies - Red Party p_2 extent agree disagree following policies - Green Party p_3 extent agree disagree following policies - Yellow Party p_4 extent agree disagree following policies - Blue Party f_uni following universities prefer study ? open_comments comments survey? resp_status Response status

what: Generate A Quarto Survey Report — gen_qmd_chapters
title: Generate A Quarto Survey Report — gen_qmd_chapters
text: function generates set saros chapters, collectively called report.

title: Generate A Quarto Survey Report — gen_qmd_chapters
code: gen_qmd_chapters(   chapter_structure,   data,   authors_col = "author",   path = NULL,   ignore_heading_for_group = NULL,   replace_heading_for_group = NULL,   prefix_heading_for_group = NULL,   suffix_heading_for_group = NULL,   chapter_yaml_file = NULL,   chapter_qmd_start_section_filepath = NULL,   chapter_qmd_end_section_filepath = NULL,   attach_chapter_dataset = TRUE,   auxiliary_variables = NULL,   serialized_format = "rds" )

title: Generate A Quarto Survey Report — gen_qmd_chapters
text: chapter_structure goes chapter sub-chapter obj:<data.frame>|obj:<tbl_df> // Required Data frame (tibble, possibly grouped). One row per chapter. contain columns 'chapter' 'dep', Optionally 'indep' (independent variables) informative columns needed. data Survey data obj:<data.frame>|obj:<tbl_df>|obj:<srvyr> // Required data frame (srvyr-object) columns specified chapter_structure 'dep', etc columns. authors_col Column name author scalar<character> // default: "author" (optional) used exists. Multiple authors separated semicolon (optionally subsequent space). path Output path scalar<character> // default: tempdir() (optional) Path save output. Defaults temporary directory. ignore_heading_for_group Ignore heading group vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Type refined chapter_structure data suppress heading report output. Typically variable_name_dep, variable_name_indep, etc. replace_heading_for_group Replacing heading group named vector<character> // default: c(".variable_label_suffix_dep" = ".variable_name_dep") Occasionally, one needs replace heading another piece information refined chapter_structure. instance, one may want organize output variable_name_indep, display variable_label_indep instead. Use name replacement value original. prefix_heading_for_group, suffix_heading_for_group Prefix suffix headings vector<named character> // default: NULL (optional) Names heading_groups, values prefixes suffixes. Note prefixes end \n headings must begin new line. chapter_yaml_file Path YAML-file insert chapter qmd-file scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Path file used insert header YAML, chapter. attach_chapter_dataset Toggle inclusion chapter-specific datasets qmd-files scalar<logical> // default: FALSE Whether save chapter folder 'Rds'-file chapter-specific dataset, load top QMD-file. auxiliary_variables Auxiliary variables included datasets vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Column names data always included datasets chapter qmd-files, attach_chapter_dataset=TRUE. publicly available. serialized_format Serialized format scalar<string> // default: "rds" Format serialized data storing chapter dataset. One "rds" (default), "qs" "fst". latter two requires respective packages installed. "qs" usually fastest space efficient, sets package dependencies report project.

title: Generate A Quarto Survey Report — gen_qmd_chapters
text: Side-effects: qmd-files generated specified working directory.

title: Generate A Quarto Survey Report — gen_qmd_chapters
text: report consists multiple chapters, index file, optionally combined report file merges together. chapter can contain user-defined set dependent, independent bivariate variable sets. chapter consists multiple sections. section defined group chapter_structure (ignoring chapter grouping level) containing variables type, meaning minimum variables section sharing response options, main question, data type.

what: Generate Quarto Index File That Merges All Chapters — gen_qmd_file
title: Generate Quarto Index File That Merges All Chapters — gen_qmd_file
text: function creates index Quarto file (QMD) merges chapters specified order. can also include optional title author(s) information.

title: Generate Quarto Index File That Merges All Chapters — gen_qmd_file
code: gen_qmd_file(   path = NULL,   filename = "0_report",   yaml_file = NULL,   qmd_start_section_filepath = NULL,   qmd_end_section_filepath = NULL,   chapter_structure = NULL,   title = NULL,   authors = NULL,   output_formats = NULL,   output_filename = NULL,   call = rlang::caller_env() )

title: Generate Quarto Index File That Merges All Chapters — gen_qmd_file
text: path String, write qmd-file. filename String, bare name qmd-file. Default: "0_report". NULL, generates sanitized version title. filename title NULL, errors. yaml_file string containing filepath yaml-file inserted top qmd-file. qmd_start_section_filepath, qmd_end_section_filepath String, filepath qmd-file inserted start end file. chapter_structure goes chapter sub-chapter obj:<data.frame>|obj:<tbl_df> // Required Data frame (tibble, possibly grouped). One row per chapter. contain columns 'chapter' 'dep', Optionally 'indep' (independent variables) informative columns needed. title Title report scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) Added automatically YAML-header index.qmd report.qmd-files. authors Authors entire report vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) NULL, infers chapter_structure[[authors_col]], collates entire report. multiple authors per chapter, separate semicolon. Ensure consistency. output_filename, output_formats Character. applied, construct list links files said output_filename. call Internal call argument. fiddled user.

title: Generate Quarto Index File That Merges All Chapters — gen_qmd_file
text: string containing filepath generated Quarto report file.

get_chunk_template_defaults() #>   .template_name .template_variable_type_dep .template_variable_type_indep #> 1  cat_plot_html                     fct;ord                       fct;ord #> 2  cat_plot_html                     fct;ord                          <NA> #> 3 cat_table_html                     fct;ord                       fct;ord #> 4 cat_table_html                     fct;ord                          <NA> #> 5      chr_table                         chr                          <NA> #>                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  .template #> 1 
::: {{#fig-{.chunk_name}}}

```{{r}}
#| fig-height: !expr fig_height_h_barchart(n_y={.n_dep}, n_cats_y={.n_cats_dep}, max_chars_y={.max_chars_dep}, n_x={.n_indep}, n_cats_x={.n_cats_indep}, max_chars_x={.max_chars_indep})
{.obj_name} <- 
	data_{.chapter_foldername} |>
		makeme(dep = c({.variable_name_dep}), 
		indep = c({.variable_name_indep}), 
		type = 'cat_plot_html')
nrange <- stringi::stri_c('N = ', n_range2({.obj_name}))
link <- make_link(data = {.obj_name}$data)
link_plot <- make_link(data = {.obj_name}, 
		file_suffix = '.png', link_prefix='[PNG](', 
		save_fn = ggsaver)
x <- I(paste0(c(nrange, link, link_plot), collapse=', '))
girafe(ggobj = {.obj_name})
```

_{.variable_label_prefix_dep}_ by _{tolower(.variable_label_prefix_indep)}_. `{{r}} x`.

title: Handle numbering inheritance — handle_numbering_inheritance
text: counter digit numbering_prefix One "none" (zero-leading prefix), "max_global" (counts leading zeroes matching maximally observed items subfolders), "max_local" (max_global, considering current folder item) max_folder_count_digits Integer. fixed width counting. parent_path String, path parent folder. parent_numbering String, NA. NA, adds parent_numbering left side counter. numbering_parent_child_separator String, separates parent number child number, parent_numbering NA. count_existing_folders Flag. Whether consider existing folders counting. Defaults FALSE.

title: Initialize Folder Structure — initialize_saros_project
code: initialize_saros_project(   path,   structure_path = NULL,   numbering_prefix = c("none", "max_local", "max_global"),   numbering_inheritance = TRUE,   word_separator = NULL,   numbering_name_separator = " ",   replacement_list = NULL,   numbering_parent_child_separator = word_separator,   case = c("asis", "sentence", "title", "lower", "upper", "snake"),   count_existing_folders = FALSE,   r_files_out_path = NULL,   r_files_source_path = system.file("templates", "r_files.csv", package = "saros.base"),   r_optionals = TRUE,   r_add_file_scope = TRUE,   r_prefix_file_scope = "### ",   r_add_folder_scope_as_README = FALSE,   create = TRUE )

title: Initialize Folder Structure — initialize_saros_project
text: path String, path create project files structure_path String. Path YAML file defines folder structure. Defaults system.file("templates", "_project_structure_en.yaml"). numbering_prefix String. One c("none", "max_local", "max_global"). numbering_inheritance Flag. Whether inherit numbering parent folder. word_separator String. Replace separators words folder names. Defaults NULL. numbering_name_separator String. Separator numbering part name. replacement_list named character vector. name vector replaced "{{value}}" structure_path file numbering_parent_child_separator String. Defaults word_separator. case String. One c("asis", "sentence", "lower", "upper", "title", "snake"). count_existing_folders Boolean. Defaults FALSE. r_files_out_path String, path place R placeholder files. NULL, create . r_files_source_path String, path find CSV-field containing columns folder_name, folder_scope, file_name, file_scope. NULL, defaults system.file("templates", "r_files.csv")). r_optionals Flag. Whether add files marked 1 (TRUE) optional column. Defaults TRUE. r_add_file_scope Flag. Whether add value column 'file_scope' beginning file. Default TRUE. r_prefix_file_scope String add file_scope. Defaults "### " r_add_folder_scope_as_README Flag. Whether create README file folder folder_scope column cell r_files_source_path. Defaults FALSE. create Boolean. Defaults TRUE initialize_saros_project(), FALSE create_directory_structure().

title: Processes A 'chapter_overview' Data Frame — refine_chapter_overview
text: chapter_overview goes chapter sub-chapter obj:<data.frame>|obj:<tbl_df> // Required Data frame (tibble, possibly grouped). One row per chapter. contain columns 'chapter' 'dep', Optionally 'indep' (independent variables) informative columns needed. data Survey data obj:<data.frame>|obj:<tbl_df>|obj:<srvyr> // Required data frame (srvyr-object) columns specified chapter_structure 'dep', etc columns. chunk_templates Chunk templates obj:<data.frame>|obj:<tbl_df>|NULL // default: NULL (optional) Must contain columns name (user-specified unique name template), template (chunk template {glue}-specification, variable_type_dep optionally variable_type_indep. latter two list-columns prototype vectors specifying data template applied . Can optionally contain columns whose names match default options function. override default function-wide options specific template. label_separator Variable label separator scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) String split labels main question sub-items. name_separator Variable name separator scalar<character> // default: NULL (optional) String split column names data main question sub-items single_y_bivariates_if_indep_cats_above Single y bivariates indep-cats ... scalar<integer> // default: 3 (optional) Figures tables bivariates can become long independent variable many categories. argument specifies number indep categories single y bivariates shown. single_y_bivariates_if_deps_above Single y bivariates dep-vars ... scalar<integer> // default: 20 (optional) Figures tables bivariates can become long many dependent variables battery/question matrix. argument specifies number dep variables single y bivariates shown. Set 0 always show single y bivariates. always_show_bi_for_indep Always show bivariate indep-variable vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Specific combinations -variable bivariates always shown. hide_bi_entry_if_sig_above p-value threshold hiding bivariate entry scalar<double> // default: 1 (optional) Whether hide bivariate entry significance value. Defaults showing . hide_chunk_if_n_below Hide result N scalar<integer> // default: 10 (optional) Whether hide result N given dataset value. NOTE: Exceptions made chr_table chr_plot typically exempted first place. might change future separate argument. hide_variable_if_all_na Hide variable outputs containing NA scalar<boolean> // default: TRUE (optional) Whether remove variables values NA. organize_by Grouping columns vector<character> // default: NULL (optional) Column names used identifying chapters sections. arrange_section_by Grouping columns vector<character> named vector<logical> // default: NULL (optional) Column names used sorting section within organize_by group. character vector, assume arranged ascending order. named logical vector, FALSE indicate ascending, TRUE descending. Defaults sorting ascending order (alphabetical) commonly needed variable name/label info, descending order chunk_templates one typically wants univariates bivariates. na_first_in_section Whether place NAs first sorting scalar<logical> // default: TRUE (optional) Default ascending descending sorting dplyr::arrange() place NAs end. placed univariates end, etc. Thus, saros places NAs first section. Set FALSE override. max_width_obj, max_width_chunk, max_width_file Maximum object width scalar<integer> // default: NULL (optional) Maximum width names objects (R/Python environment), chunks (#| label: ) optional files. Note, always replace variable labels variable names, avoid long file names. Note filenames: Due OneDrive max path 400 characters, can quickly exceeded long path base path, long file names using labels part structure, hashing Quarto's cache: true feature. Thus consider restricting max_width_file lower optimally wished . max_width_folder_name Maximum clean folder name length scalar<integer> // default: NULL (optional) Whereas max_width_file truncates file name, argument truncates folder name. impact report chapter names website, folders. sep_obj, sep_chunk, sep_file Separator string scalar<character> // default: "_" (optional) Separator use grouping variables. Defaults underscore object names hyphen chunk labels file names. ... Dynamic dots <dynamic-dots> Arguments forwarded corresponding functions create elements. progress Whether display progress message scalar<logical> // default: TRUE Mostly useful hide_bi_entry_if_sig_above < 1 variable_group_dep Name variable_group_dep column scalar<string> // default: ".variable_group_dep" column used group variables part bivariate analysis. variable_group_prefix Set prefix easily find labels scalar<string> // default: NULL default, .variable_group column just integers. wish use part object/label/filename numbering scheme, number informative. Hence set prefix "Group" distinguish column columns chapter_structure. n_range_glue_template_1, n_range_glue_template_2 scalar<string> // default: "{n}" "[{n[1]}, {n[2]}] (optional) Glue templates n_range columns created. log_file Path log file scalar<string> // default: "_log.txt" (optional) Path log file. Set NULL disable logging.

title: Processes A 'chapter_overview' Data Frame — refine_chapter_overview
text: Grouped tibble.

title: Processes A 'chapter_overview' Data Frame — refine_chapter_overview
code: ref_df <- refine_chapter_overview(chapter_overview = ex_survey_ch_overview) #> `chunk_templates` is NULL. Using global defaults. #> Refining chapter_overview into a chapter_structure ... # \donttest{ ref_df2 <- refine_chapter_overview(chapter_overview = ex_survey_ch_overview,                      data = ex_survey, hide_bi_entry_if_sig_above=.05) #> `chunk_templates` is NULL. Using global defaults. #> Refining chapter_overview into a chapter_structure ... #> Removing bivariate occurences if `hide_bi_entry_if_sig_above`: `0.05`, except . #> Refining chapter_overview into a chapter_structure ... #> Not using the following variables in `data`: `x1_sex`, `x2_human`, `a_7`, #> `a_8`, `c_1`, `c_2`, `f_uni`, and `resp_status`. # }

what: Post-render rendering of complete reports — render_full_reports
title: Post-render rendering of complete reports — render_full_reports
text: one wishes render complete reports linked website, listed among chapters sidebar menu, one can make filenames starting underscores (_) make listed said menu. However, also mean rendered Quarto (Website) project. function, can called within post-script (see example ), render ordinary rendering project, copied _site folder.

title: Post-render rendering of complete reports — render_full_reports
code: render_full_reports(   files = NULL,   path,   processable_path = file.path(path, "Reports"),   site_path = file.path(path, "_site"),   resource_paths = file.path(path, c("_extensions", "_images")),   warn_on_file_error = FALSE,   ... )

title: Post-render rendering of complete reports — render_full_reports
text: files Optional character vector report files (qmd). Can obtained within project Sys.getenv("QUARTO_PROJECT_OUTPUT_FILES") path files given, path root folder local "site". processable_path Path report files can (recursively) found. site_path Path _site resource_paths Paths _extensions _images folders can found copied wherever needed warn_on_file_error TRUE, collect warnings file fails render copied. FALSE (default), stop rendering process. ... Additional arguments passed quarto::render()

title: Post-render rendering of complete reports — render_full_reports
text: Returns invisibly character vector processed files.

what: Setup files needed for basic password-based access restriction for website — setup_access_restrictions
title: Setup files needed for basic password-based access restriction for website — setup_access_restrictions
text: Create _headers file 'Netlify' publishing set .htaccess .htpasswd files (FTP) placed specific subfolders.

title: Setup files needed for basic password-based access restriction for website — setup_access_restrictions
code: setup_access_restrictions(   remote_basepath = "/home/",   local_basepath,   rel_path_base_to_parent_of_user_restricted_folder = file.path("Reports", "2022",     "Mesos"),   warn = TRUE,   local_main_password_path = ".main_htpasswd_public",   username_folder_matching_df = NULL,   universal_usernames = c("admin"),   log_rounds = 12,   append_users = TRUE,   password_input = "prompt",   type = c("netlify", "apache") )

title: Setup files needed for basic password-based access restriction for website — setup_access_restrictions
text: remote_basepath String. Folder site located using FTP-server. Needed .htaccess-files. local_basepath String. Local folder website, typically "_site". rel_path_base_to_parent_of_user_restricted_folder String, relative path basepath folder restricted folders located. (E.g. "mesos"-folder) warn Flag. Whether provide warning error paths exist. local_main_password_path String. Path main file containing usernames passwords formatted colon username password. username_folder_matching_df Data frame. NULL (default), use folder names usernames. Otherwise, data frame two columns: "folder" "username" "folder" name folder "username" username folder. universal_usernames Character vector. Usernames local_main_htpasswd_path always access folder log_rounds Integer, number rounds bcrypt algorithm. higher time consuming harder brute-force. append_users Boolean, TRUE (default) create new users add local_main_password_path. See also password_input. password_input String, either "prompt" asks user input. Alternatively, number stored string generated random password said length: "8", "10", "12", "16" type Character vector. "netlify" create _headers file used Netlify. "apache" create .htaccess .htpasswd files used general FTP-servers.

title: Setup files needed for basic password-based access restriction for website — setup_access_restrictions
text: String, path newly created _headers-file .htaccess files.

what: Write Default Arguments for draft_report() to YAML-file — write_default_draft_report_args
title: Write Default Arguments for draft_report() to YAML-file — write_default_draft_report_args
text: Write Default Arguments draft_report() YAML-file

title: Write Default Arguments for draft_report() to YAML-file — write_default_draft_report_args
code: write_default_draft_report_args(   path,   ignore_args = c("data", "...", "dep", "indep", "chapter_structure", "chapter_overview",     "path") )

title: Write Default Arguments for draft_report() to YAML-file — write_default_draft_report_args
text: path scalar<character> // Required. default: settings.yaml ignore_args vector<character> // Optional. default: c("data", "...", "dep", "indep", "chapter_structure", "chapter_overview") character vector argument (names) written file.

title: Write Default Arguments for draft_report() to YAML-file — write_default_draft_report_args
text: defaults yaml-object.

title: Write Default Arguments for draft_report() to YAML-file — write_default_draft_report_args
code: write_default_draft_report_args(path=tempfile(fileext=".yaml")) #> [1] "/tmp/Rtmp8xOdrB/file16715357e428.yaml"
